newsitem.title: USA: NY precious metals called to open flat to firmer.
newsitem.headline: NY precious metals called to open flat to firmer.

text.p: COMEX and NYMEX precious metals futures were called to open flat to firmer Wednesday, but gold once again made little progress in tackling upside resistance overnight, dealers said.
COMEX June gold was called up $0.40 to $0.80 from Tuesday's close of $341.50 an ounce.
COMEX July silver was called flat to 1.00 cent higher from Tuesday's close of $4.733.
Some light shortcovering dried up amid trader skepticism over any significant volumes of central bank gold sales.
COMEX June gold was traded $342.50 to $341.40 in overnight ACCESS trading.
July silver was traded between $4.745 and $4.73 in overnight ACCESS trading. In London silver fixed lower at $4.721 on Wednesday from $4.752 on Tuesday, but good support was seen at $4.70.
On Tuesday COMEX silver stocks rose by 1,310,102 ounces to 192,174,748 ounces, while COMEX gold stocks fell 35,135 ounces to 910,877 ounces.
NYMEX July platinum and NYMEX June palladium were called to open flat to up $0.50 an ounce. Both remained rangebound in overnight trading.
